summary.p: mod_slotmem_plain is a memory provider which provides for creation and access to a plain memory segment in which the datasets are organized in "slots."
If the memory needs to be shared between threads and processes, a better provider would be mod_slotmem_shm.
mod_slotmem_plain provides the following API functions:

dl.dd: call the callback on all worker slots
dl.dt: apr_status_t create(ap_slotmem_instance_t **new, const char *name, apr_size_t item_size, unsigned int item_num, ap_slotmem_type_t type, apr_pool_t *pool)
dl.dd: create a new slotmem with each item size is item_size.
dl.dt: apr_status_t attach(ap_slotmem_instance_t **new, const char *name, apr_size_t *item_size, unsigned int *item_num, apr_pool_t *pool)
apr_status_t dptr(ap_slotmem_instance_t *s, unsigned int item_id, void**mem)
dl.dd: get the direct pointer to the memory associated with this worker slot.
dl.dt: apr_status_t get(ap_slotmem_instance_t *s, unsigned int item_id, unsigned char *dest, apr_size_t dest_len)
dl.dd: get/read the memory from this slot to dest
dl.dt: apr_status_t put(ap_slotmem_instance_t *slot, unsigned int item_id, unsigned char *src, apr_size_t src_len)
dl.dd: put/write the data from src to this slot
return the total number of slots in the segment
return the total data size, in bytes, of a slot in the segment
grab or allocate a slot and mark as in-use (does not do any data copying)
release or free a slot and mark as not in-use (does not do any data copying)
